name: The Quirky Quaint "Q" Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the hunchback in Victor Hugo's "The Hunchback of Notre Dame"?
questions.explanation:
Quasimodo.

	Victor Hugo also wrote "Les Misérables".

questions.text: The sixth president of the United States had what middle name?
questions.explanation:
Quincy.

	John Quincy Adams was the son of the second president of the US John Adams. Braintree, Mass. where he was born, later was changed to Quincy, Mass.

questions.text: Who was George Bush's vice president? (The original Bush, not George W.)
questions.explanation:
Quayle, Dan.

	Dan Quayle was going to run for President in the 2000 election, but he withdrew.

Queen.

	The members of Queen were: Brian May, Roger Taylor, John Deacon, and Freddie Mercury.

questions.text: What is the name of the computer in the "Veggie Tales" series?
questions.explanation:
Qwerty.

	QWERTY are most commonly the first six letters on the keyboard.

questions.text: What is another word for a doctor who doesn't know what he's doing?
questions.explanation:
quack.

	If a doctor is a quack, he is making bad health judgments and not trusted by patients. He most likely will not be a doctor for long.

questions.text: What is a four sided polygon called?
questions.explanation:
Quadrilateral.

	The prefix "quad" means four. Lateral means side. So a quadrilateral has four sides.

questions.text: What is another word for line of waiting people?
questions.explanation:
queue.

	Queue is pronounced the same as "cue".

questions.text: Who was ruler of England in 1890?
questions.explanation:
Queen Victoria.

	Queen Victoria was born on May 24, 1819. She died on January 22, 1901.

questions.text: What is the correct title for one of the books in the "Vampire Chronicles" by Anne Rice?
questions.explanation:
Queen of the Damned.

	"Queen of the Damned" is the third book in the series. It follows "Interview with the Vampire" and "The Vampire Lestat."
